source.title: RML: Reachability Meta-Learning
source.file: Formalizing tuple drift in quantum-native learning/PAPER3_COMPLETE.md

claim: Structure-aware control via pre-trained topological predicates achieves superior oracle efficiency compared to ground-truth simulation

concepts.control_task: Navigate from (b,e) to diagonal target within k steps
concepts.structure_aware: Query learned predicates instead of simulate

invariants: QAWM predicates computed without additional oracle calls
Generator selection based on learned topology, not simulation
Deterministic scoring function produces replayable traces
Cross-task transfer: same QAWM model for arbitrary targets

failure_modes.description: QAWM-Greedy has lower raw success (32% vs 60%)
failure_modes.mitigation: Normalized by oracle calls - efficiency metric is primary

failure_modes.description: Greedy selection may miss multi-step optimal paths

qa_theoretical_contribution: Establishes structure-aware control as distinct paradigm from RL and symbolic planning
